questions.question_text: ׀ new stakeholder has been added to a project with a BAG of $850,000. The stakeholder has raised five change requests to the CCB; two of them have been approved, and three are awaiting initial review. Considering the project has a CPI of 0.89 and an SPI of 1.14, and the approved ones will be implemented, which of the following should the project manager do LAST?

comments.content: Also BAG should be BAC Budget at Completion, but it's irrelevant since this is all distraction away from the simple answer of what is last in a change request.

discussion.content: This question is obviously trying to confuse people... It's just a change request question. The answer provided, D, is correct.

questions.question_text: A project manager has been asked to prepare and present a review of the execution phase. Which of the following is the BEST audience for this review?

discussion.content: D. Project team is responsible for the review at the end of the execution phase...
B. is what I'm going with.
It should be the Key stakeholders which also includes the team.

questions.question_text: Which of the following inherently affects quality standards?

discussion.content: The WBS contains information such as quality requirements, resource requirements... SLA is just about how the work will done as an agreement between the vendor and purchaser.

Selected Answer: D
The given answer is right. In the WBS you define the scope, schedule and budget for each task. Those are the 3 items in the PM triangle or triangle constraints. Remember they say pick 2 of the 3 cheap, fast or good. each one of those are inherently going to effect quality.
I know this is PMP related, but if the project is in Operations then SLA would be most appropriate.

Selected Answer: A
I believe the answer should be SLA

choices.B: Dashboard information, action items, project schedule, and status report
choices.D: Project schedule, project management plan, communication plan, and issue log
choices.A: Project charter, organization chart, scope statement, and issue log
choices.C: Project management plan, scope statement, communication plan, and meeting agendas

questions.question_text: At a weekly project team meeting, it is apparent the project is over budget. The project manager needs to determine the reason for this issue. Which of the following documents should MOST likely be analyzed to obtain the answer?

discussion.content: I don't think that the given answer of A is correct. Why would the PM need to review all of the project support documents when the PM created them? It's behind schedule so the PM would need to review all of the information as defined in answer B. I think B is the correct answer.

comments.content: Why would you need to review the Organization chart for the budget?
Correct I also realized the "dashboard" is not a document.

Organization chart shows the breakdown of who is on each team, so combined with the other items such as issue log, perhaps one team or team member is not capable of completing the job. Depending on the length of a project it's easy to not see the forest for the trees, and perhaps the charter original goals have been forgotten by the PM or team members. I went with A because the other choices didn't make sense, communication plan? How is that relevant, so C and D, instantly no consideration. B is really close but the Dashboard is a high-level rough overview of the plan for executives to track progress. The PM already knows the project is over budget, I'm not sure what benefit the dashboard is providing that the PM isn't already aware of, the dashboard is updated frequently but the charter might be quite dated by the time you start looking at why you're over budget.
I see what you are saying. But A would include the project charter and issue log which would help determine why they are over budget.

discussion.content:
D is the answer I would choose. it has the project management plan, "Used as the guideline throughout the project Executing and Controlling phases to track 
and measure project performance and to make future project decisions. It’s also used as a 
communication and information tool for stakeholders, team members, and management"- Sybex study guide pk0-004 2nd ed, Also it has the issue log & the schedule. Comm plan you can see who communicated to whom.

The keyword here is "apparent" meaning the PM is already aware of what's happening and needs to find the causes of the issue. Dashboard and status report are not as helpful as the project scopes and issues log which may contain possible clues to the issue.

Selected Answer: A
The answer is correct. 

B is incorrect because action items are not required to be listed as they are not always critical. On a side note the dashboard is ABSOLUTELY a document. It doesn't have to be a paper or word document.

C. Com plan and meeting agenda have no relevance. 
D. Com plan again has no relevance.

A. Organizational chart, like mentioned before would show what and how many resources you have assigned to a particular area or task which is a major budget concern.
I chose D as an answer because of the appealing 'project management plan' even though the communication plan might seem nonsensical. Without the plan, how could you even know what went wrong?
Agree, the keyword is analyzed. Dashboard Information and status report are a great place to dive into understanding how problems develop.

questions.question_text: The PMO is responsible for: (Choose two.)

choices.B: contributing expertise, deliverables, and estimates of costs.
choices.D: outlining consequences of non-performance and coordinating between disparate projects.
choices.A: managing the project plan, scope, risk, and budget.
choices.C: setting standards and practices for the organization and providing governance.
choices.E: approving funding, developing the project schedule, and gathering high-level requirements.
